workflow.name: Generate intraday AAPL trade signals using live data, OpenAI, Telegram and Notion
workflow.description:
## ðŸ“˜ Description
 This workflow automates short-interval market signal evaluation for intraday trading using live technical indicators and deterministic decision logic. It is designed for traders, analysts, and automation teams who want fast, auditable trade signals without manual chart monitoring or subjective interpretation.
On a fixed 5-minute schedule, the workflow fetches live price, volume, RSI, and EMA data for AAPL and combines them into a unified market snapshot. A deterministic computation layer derives clear trend and momentum signals, ensuring indicator logic remains transparent and non-AI. These signals are then evaluated by a strict, rule-based AI decision engine that returns a structured verdictâ€”APPROVE, WAIT, or REJECTâ€”along with confidence and a concise reason.
Trade decisions are routed instantly to Telegram for real-time visibility and logged to Notion for historical analysis and auditability. Built-in error handling ensures any workflow failure is reported immediately.
## âš ï¸ Deployment Disclaimer
 This workflow is intended for self-hosted n8n instances only.
 It relies on frequent polling, external market data APIs, and advanced AI agent orchestration not suitable for n8n Cloud.
âš™ï¸ What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)
 â° Scheduled Market Data Polling
 Runs automatically every 5 minutes to capture fresh market data.
 ðŸ“¡ Fetch Live Market Indicators
 Pulls AAPL price, volume, RSI, and EMA from the market data provider.
 ðŸ”— Merge Indicator Streams
 Combines all indicators into a synchronized market snapshot.
 ðŸ§® Compute Trend & Momentum (Deterministic)
 Derives bullish, bearish, or neutral signals using fixed logicâ€”no AI.
 ðŸ§  Evaluate Trade Decision (AI)
 Applies strict rule-based logic to return verdict, confidence, and reason.
 ðŸ”€ Route Trade by Verdict
 Separates approved vs non-approved signals automatically.
 ðŸ“£ Send Telegram Trade Alerts
 Delivers real-time trade decisions directly to Telegram.
 ðŸ—‚ Log Decisions to Notion
 Stores every verdict for tracking, analysis, and audit.
 ðŸš¨ Workflow Error Handler â†’ Email Alert
 Sends immediate notifications if any step fails.
## ðŸ§© Prerequisites
 â€¢ Self-hosted n8n instance
 â€¢ Market data API (e.g., Twelve Data)
 â€¢ OpenAI API credentials
 â€¢ Telegram Bot API
 â€¢ Notion API access
## ðŸ’¡ Key Benefits
 âœ” Fully automated intraday signal monitoring
 âœ” Transparent, auditable indicator calculations
 âœ” Strict, deterministic AI decision logic
 âœ” Real-time Telegram alerts without opening n8n
 âœ” Centralized trade history in Notion
 âœ” Reliable error detection and reporting
## ðŸ‘¥ Perfect For
 Active traders and market analysts
 Quant and rule-based trading teams
 Automation engineers building trading assistants
 Founders prototyping decision-support trading systems

workflow.name: Automated Stock Trade Signals Using Live Market Data and Telegram Alerts

nodes.name: Merge RSI, Price, and EMA Streams

options.systemMessage:
You are a trading decision engine.

Rules:
- Do NOT calculate indicators.
- Do NOT modify numeric values.
- Use only the signals provided in the input JSON.
- Be deterministic and conservative.
- Do NOT add trading advice, disclaimers, or extra text.
- Output MUST be valid JSON only.

Decision logic:
- If trend is "BULLISH" AND volume is high AND momentum is "BULLISH" â†’ APPROVE
- If trend is "BULLISH" AND volume is high AND momentum is "NEUTRAL" â†’ WAIT
- If trend is "BEARISH" â†’ REJECT
- Otherwise â†’ REJECT

Confidence rules:
- APPROVE â†’ HIGH
- WAIT â†’ MEDIUM
- REJECT â†’ LOW

nodes.name: LLM Engine for Trade Decision Reasoning
Route Trade Based on Verdict = APPROVE
Send Trade Alert â€” APPROVED Path (Telegram)
Send Trade Alert â€” NON-APPROVED Path (Telegram)
Log Trade Decision to Notion (Market Signals DB)

parameters.subject: Workflow Error Alert

parameters.content:
## Error Handling
Sends alerts when the workflow fails

## ðŸ“ˆ Automated Stock Trade Signals Using Live Market Data and Telegram Alerts

### How it works
This workflow runs on a scheduled 5-minute interval to analyze short-term market conditions for AAPL using live technical indicators. It fetches the latest price, volume, RSI, and EMA data from Twelve Data and merges them into a unified market snapshot.

A deterministic calculation layer computes trend and momentum signals without AI involvement, ensuring transparent and auditable indicator logic. These computed signals are then passed to an AI decision engine that applies strict, rule-based logic to determine whether a trade should be approved, delayed, or rejected.

The AI does not calculate indicators or modify values. It only evaluates the provided signals and returns a structured verdict with confidence and a concise reason. Based on the verdict, the workflow routes alerts to Telegram, logs all decisions to Notion for historical tracking, and ensures every signal is recorded for analysis and audit.

This setup provides fast, repeatable intraday signal evaluation while maintaining separation between calculation logic and decision logic. It is designed for monitoring and decision supportâ€”not autonomous trading execution.

### Setup steps
1. Set the schedule interval (5-minute polling).
2. Add Twelve Data API credentials.
3. Configure OpenAI credentials for decision evaluation.
4. Set Telegram chat ID for alerts.
5. Connect Notion database for signal logging.

## Market Data Polling
Runs on a fixed 5-minute schedule and pulls the latest
AAPL price, volume, RSI, and EMA data from Twelve Data.
This ensures all downstream logic works on fresh,
synchronized market inputs.

## Signal Computation
Combines RSI, price, volume, and EMA into a single
market snapshot. Applies deterministic logic to
derive trend and momentum signals before AI evaluation.

## AI Trade Decision
Uses a strict, rule-based AI agent to evaluate computed
signals and return a structured trade verdict with
confidence and a concise reasoning statement.

## Trade Routing & Alerts
Routes trades based on the AI verdict and sends
real-time alerts to Telegram so decisions are visible
immediately without opening n8n.

## ðŸ” Required Credentials & Security

- Twelve Data API (market data)
- OpenAI API (decision evaluation)
- Telegram Bot API (trade alerts)
- Notion API (signal logging)

Use environment variables or n8n credentials for all API keys.
Never hard-code secrets in HTTP nodes.
Limit API permissions to read-only where possible.

## Telegram Trade Alerts
Delivers real-time trade verdicts directly to Telegram.
Both approved and non-approved decisions are sent,
ensuring visibility without opening n8n. Ideal for
fast reaction and continuous monitoring.

## Audit Logging
Stores all trade decisions for analysis and traceability.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
